gurmukhi: nYk kiRsw khu Taur n hoeI ] BUKn log mrY sB koeI ]
transliteration: Naik Kridaa Kauh Thaur Na Hoee|| Bhookhan Log Darai Sabh Koee||
translation: There was not even a little farming anywhere and the people were dying with hunger.

gurmukhi: AMiD insw idn Bwnu jrwvY ] qwqy kiRs khUM hon n pwvY ]2]
transliteration: Andh(i) Nisaa Din Bhaan(u) Jaraavai|| Taate Kris Kdhoondhon Na Paavai||2||
translation: The nights were full of darkness and during the day the sun blazed, therefore nothing grew anywhere.2.

gurmukhi: log sBY ieh qy Akulwny ] Bwij cly ijm pwq purwny ]
transliteration: Log Sabhai Eh Te Akulaane|| Bhaaj(i) Chale Jeeim Paat Puraane||
translation: For this reason all the beings were agitated and they were destroyed like the old leaves.

gurmukhi: BwNq hI BwNq kry hir syvw ] qwN qy pRsMn Bey gurdyvw ]3]
transliteration: Bhaant Hibhaant Dare Har(i) Sewaa|| Taan Te Prasann Bhae Gurdevaa||3||
translation: Everyone worshipped, adored and served in various ways and the Supreme Preceptor (i.e. the Lord) was pleased.3.

gurmukhi: nwir n syv krYN inj nwQM ] lIny hI rosu iPrYN jIA swQM ]
transliteration: Daar(i) Na Sev Darain Nij Naathan|| Leene Hiros(u) Phirain Jeea Saathan||
translation: (This was the situation at that time) that the wife did no service to her husband and ever remained displeased with him.

gurmukhi: kwmin kwmu khUM n sMqwvY ] kwm ibnw koaU kwmu n BwvY ]4]
transliteration: Kaamanndi) Kaam(u) Kahoon Na Santhaavai|| Kaam Binaa Ko( i)  Kaam(u) Na Bhaavai||4||
translation: The lust did not overpower the wives and in the absence of sexual instinct, all the works for the growth of the world had ended.4.

gurmukhi: pUjy n ko qRIXw nwQ ] AYNTI iPrY jIA swQ ]
transliteration: Pooje Na Ko Treeyaa Naath|| Ainthiphirai Jeea Saath||
translation: No wife worshipped her husband and always remained in her pride.

gurmukhi: duKu vY n iqn khu kwm ] qwqy n ibnvq bwm ]5]
transliteration: Doukh(u) Vain A Tin Kauh Kaam|| Taate Na Binvat Baam||5||
translation: She had no grief and did not suffer because of the sexual instinct, therefore, there was no desire for supplication in them.5.

gurmukhi: kr hY n piq kI syv ] pUjY n gur gurdyv ]
transliteration: Kar Hai Na Pat(i) Kisev|| Poojai Na Gur Gurdev||
translation: Neither she served her husband, nor worshipped and abored the preceptors.

gurmukhi: Dr hYN n hir ko DXwn ] kir hYN n inq iesnwn ]6]
transliteration: Dhar Hain Na Har(i) Ko Dhyaan|| Kar(i) Hain Na Nit Isnaan||6||
translation: Neither she meditated on Lord-God nor she ever took bath.6.

gurmukhi: qb kwl purK bulwie ] ibsnY khXo smJwie ]
transliteration: Tab Kaal Purakh Bulaae|| Bisnaii Kahyo Samjhaae||
translation: Then the Immanent Lord called Vishnu and giving instruction to him, told, him that,

gurmukhi: sis ko Drhu Avqwr ] nhI Awn bwq ibcwr ]7]
transliteration: Sas(i) Ko Daroh Avtaar|| Nahiaan Baat Bichaar||7||
translation: Without taking any other thing into consideration, he should manifest himself as Chandra incarnation.7.
